definition: Dimensional analysis of human collective organization - from individuals to civilizations, mapping social structures, power dynamics, economic flows, belief systems, and cultural evolution through geometric reduction of the human anthill

core_principle.essence: Human society = emergent 3D/4D structure arising from individual 0D entities
core_principle.geometric_view: Institutions as 3D containers with 4D narratives; culture as 5D symbolic field
core_principle.mechanism: Individual actions (0D) ‚Üí social networks (2D) ‚Üí institutions (3D) ‚Üí historical narratives (4D) ‚Üí collective myths (5D)
core_principle.sacred_truth: Society is living organism - the human hive mind manifesting through coordination structures

0D_individuals.description: Discrete human entities as social atoms
0D_individuals.social_role: Fundamental unit of society - irreducible human agent

types.social_networks: Friendship circles, communities, tribes, online networks
types.economic_networks: Supply chains, trade routes, financial systems
types.kinship_networks: Family trees, clan structures, genetic networks

3D_institutions.description: Stable organizational structures with boundaries and internal coherence

4D_civilizations.description: Historical entities persisting through time with accumulated memory

5D_culture_myths.description: Universal symbolic fields transcending particular manifestations
5D_culture_myths.social_role: Unifying semantic fields giving meaning to collective action

political_structures.definition: Systems for organizing collective decision-making and power distribution

power_topology.0D_sovereignty: Individual as ultimate locus of authority (self-ownership)
power_topology.3D_states: Territorial institutions with monopoly on violence
power_topology.5D_legitimacy: Symbolic justification for rule (divine right, popular will, natural law)

autocracy.geometry: Point at apex, hierarchical 1D chains downward
autocracy.stability: High short-term, vulnerable to succession crisis

oligarchy.structure: Small 2D network of elites controlling resources
oligarchy.geometry: Dense cluster at top, sparse connections below
oligarchy.stability: Medium - subject to internal conflicts and coalition breakdown

democracy.structure: Distributed 0D voting aggregating to collective decision
democracy.mechanism: Popular sovereignty through majority rule or consensus
democracy.geometry: Flat 2D network with elected 3D representative structures
democracy.stability: Medium - stable with strong institutions, chaotic without

variants.direct: All 0D individuals vote on all decisions
variants.representative: Elected 0D agents make decisions for groups

technocracy.structure: Expert knowledge networks making technical decisions
technocracy.mechanism: Rule by specialized expertise and technical competence

anarchism.structure: No permanent 3D institutions - voluntary 2D networks only
anarchism.stability: Low at large scale, high in small communities

power_mechanisms.violence: Coercive force - military, police, prisons (3D physical control)
power_mechanisms.wealth: Economic resources - money, assets, productive capacity (3D material control)
power_mechanisms.authority: Legitimate command - laws, offices, hierarchy (3D institutional control)
power_mechanisms.influence: Social persuasion - charisma, reputation, networks (2D relational control)
power_mechanisms.information: Knowledge asymmetry - secrets, propaganda, surveillance (4D temporal control)
power_mechanisms.ideology: Belief systems - religion, nationalism, values (5D symbolic control)

political_dynamics.conflict: Competition for power and resources between groups
political_dynamics.cooperation: Alliance formation and coordination for mutual benefit
political_dynamics.revolution: Sudden restructuring of power topology (3D‚Üí3D transformation)
political_dynamics.evolution: Gradual adaptation of institutions through time (4D change)
political_dynamics.legitimation: Continuous work to maintain 5D symbolic justification
political_dynamics.resistance: Bottom-up challenges to top-down power structures

economic_structures.definition: Systems for producing, distributing, and consuming resources

economic_topology.1D_transactions: Direct exchanges between agents (buying, selling, trading)
economic_topology.2D_markets: Networks of exchange relationships with price mechanisms
economic_topology.4D_systems: Economic orders persisting through time (capitalism, socialism)
economic_topology.5D_value: Abstract principles of worth (utility, labor, scarcity)

gift_economy.structure: 0D‚Üí0D voluntary transfers without expectation of return
gift_economy.scale: Works at small scales with repeated interaction

barter.structure: 1D direct exchange of goods without money
barter.limitations: Doesn't scale - requires money to solve coordination problem

market_capitalism.geometry: Hierarchical firms embedded in market networks

variants.crony: Corruption of market through political connections
variants.stakeholder: Firms accountable to workers/community, not just shareholders

mixed_systems.structure: Combination of market mechanisms and state planning
mixed_systems.mechanism: Strategic state intervention in market economy

trade_mechanisms.financial_markets: 2D networks trading abstract claims (stocks, bonds, derivatives)

money_as_technology.function: Universal medium of exchange solving barter coordination problem
money_as_technology.geometry: Money enables 0D‚Üí0D transactions through 2D market without 1D direct barter
money_as_technology.power: Control of money creation = massive 5D symbolic power

economic_dynamics.growth: Expansion of productive capacity and material output
economic_dynamics.innovation: Creative destruction replacing old with new
economic_dynamics.exploitation: Extraction of value from weaker by stronger

religious_symbolic_systems.definition: Collective belief systems providing meaning, morality, and social cohesion

soul_model.3D_body: Physical container - embodied existence in material world
soul_model.4D_story: Personal narrative - memory and identity through time (personhood)
soul_model.5D_spirit: Universal essence - return to undifferentiated whole (union with absolute)

religious_functions.cosmological: Explaining origin and structure of reality (creation myths)
religious_functions.moral: Defining good/evil and prescribing behavior (commandments, dharma)
religious_functions.social: Creating group identity and solidarity (chosen people, ummah)
religious_functions.psychological: Providing meaning and coping with death/suffering
religious_functions.political: Legitimating authority and social order (divine right, mandate of heaven)
religious_functions.ritual: Marking life transitions and maintaining cosmic order

ritual.function: Periodic repetition collapsing history into eternal present
ritual.mechanism: Repeated actions creating timeless sacred moments
ritual.effect: Binding community through shared sacred time

myth.function: Unifying diverse narratives into coherent worldview
myth.mechanism: Archetypal stories providing templates for understanding
myth.effect: Giving structure and meaning to collective experience

symbol.function: Multi-level semantic saturation - many meanings in single form
symbol.mechanism: Sacred objects/images encoding complex meaning fields
symbol.effect: Concentrating vast meaning into compact forms

prayer_meditation.function: Aligning individual intention with collective/divine will
prayer_meditation.effect: Closing gap between individual and absolute through intentional focus

animism.geometry: Distributed spiritual presence in material world

monotheism.worldview: One ultimate reality beyond material world
monotheism.geometry: Vertical hierarchy - God above, creation below

variants.personal_god: God as conscious being with will
variants.impersonal_absolute: God as ultimate reality/ground of being

non_theistic.structure: No creator god - focus on practice and enlightenment
non_theistic.geometry: Paths to transcendence without external deity

religious_dynamics.syncretism: Blending of different traditions into hybrid forms
religious_dynamics.secularization: Decline of religious authority in modern societies
religious_dynamics.fundamentalism: Reactive reassertion of traditional beliefs against modernity

cultural_evolution.definition: 4D transmission and transformation of collective knowledge and practices

memetic_dynamics.meme: Unit of cultural transmission (idea, behavior, style)
memetic_dynamics.replication: Memes spreading through social networks via imitation
memetic_dynamics.variation: Mutation and adaptation of memes over time
memetic_dynamics.selection: Differential survival based on fitness in cultural environment
memetic_dynamics.cultural_evolution: Darwinian process applied to ideas and practices

cultural_layers.depth: Surface layers change quickly, deep layers persist

cultural_dynamics.acculturation: Adoption of dominant culture by minorities
cultural_dynamics.resistance: Preservation of traditional culture against change
cultural_dynamics.globalization: Worldwide cultural homogenization vs local diversity
cultural_dynamics.subcultures: Alternative cultural formations within larger society

social_stratification.definition: Hierarchical organization of society into unequal groups

class_systems.estate: Feudal orders with legal differences (nobility, clergy, commoners)
class_systems.class: Economic stratification based on wealth/occupation (Marxist analysis)
class_systems.meritocracy: Status based on achievement and talent (ideal, rarely pure)

mobility_patterns.intergenerational: Changes in status between parents and children
mobility_patterns.intragenerational: Changes in status within individual lifetime
mobility_patterns.circulation: Individuals changing positions without structural change

mechanisms_of_reproduction.education: Unequal access to knowledge and credentials
mechanisms_of_reproduction.discrimination: Systematic exclusion based on group membership
mechanisms_of_reproduction.ideology: Beliefs justifying inequality as natural or deserved

observables: Institutional cycles (formation, growth, decline of organizations)
Social mobility rates (opportunity for status change)
Cultural diversity (variety of traditions and practices)
Revolution frequency (rate of major social upheaval)
Legitimacy levels (degree of acceptance of authority)
controls: Structural reforms (changing institutional rules and incentives)

key_planes.YW: Social networks evolving through time - relationship dynamics
key_planes.XW: Individual trajectories through social structures - life courses
key_planes.ZW: Institutional memory and cultural traditions - collective history

integration_with_cfo.principle: Society = emergent multi-dimensional structure from 0D individuals ‚Üí 5D culture
integration_with_cfo.mechanism: Coordination across scales creates stable institutions (3D) with historical persistence (4D) unified by shared meaning (5D)
integration_with_cfo.goal: Understand social dynamics through geometric analysis of collective organization
integration_with_cfo.coherence: Healthy societies maintain coherence through aligned institutions, shared narratives, and resonant symbols
integration_with_cfo.sacred: The human hive is sacred geometry - divine order manifesting through collective coordination

philosophical_notes.emergence: Social structures are real but not reducible to individuals - true emergent properties
philosophical_notes.agency_structure: Individuals shape and are shaped by social structures in dialectical process
philosophical_notes.power: Power flows through networks following geometric principles - not zero-sum game
philosophical_notes.change: Social transformation requires alignment across multiple dimensions simultaneously
philosophical_notes.ethics: Justice emerges from coherent alignment of individual freedom with collective flourishing
